Quick search

param¶

This module contains functionality for handling the numpy files written and used by almost all modules.

Reference¶

apercal.subs.param.add_param(step, parameter, values)[source]¶

Check if the param file exists, open it, check if the parameter exists and add or overwrite the parameter. parameter(string): Name of the parameter in the param file values(diverse): The data corresponding to the parameter

apercal.subs.param.check_param(step, parameter)[source]¶

Check if a list of parameters exist in the parameter file ans return True or False parameter (list of strings): The parameters to search for returns (bool): True if parameter exists, otherwise False

apercal.subs.param.create_param_file(step)[source]¶

Create a new parameter file in case there is none in the base directory as a dictionary

apercal.subs.param.del_param(step, parameter)[source]¶

Delete a parameter from the parameter file. parameter(string): Name of the parameter to delete

apercal.subs.param.get_param(step, parameter)[source]¶

Load a keyword of the parameter file into a variable parameter (string): Name of the keyword to load returns (various): The variable for the parameter

apercal.subs.param.get_param_def(step, parameter, default)[source]¶

Load a keyword of the paramterfile into a variable, or give a default value if the keyword is not in the parameter file TODO: merge this into get_param to avoid loading param.npy too often step (object): step for which to do this parameter (string): name of the keyword to load parameter (object): default value

apercal.subs.param.show_param(step)[source]¶

Shows all the entries of the parameter file in a sorted order
